pageContext.claim: “And farmers, manufacturers, union, non-union, everybody -- everybody wants [the USMCA]. ”
pageContext.analysis: Many major unions have expressed concern about the USMCA and withheld support for it, including the AFL-CIO, the United Automobile Workers, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers and the United Electrical, Radio and Machine Workers of America. AFL-CIO President Richard Trumka has warned House Democrats not to expedite approval of the new North American trade deal, saying that the agreement remains far from complete and that a vote in coming weeks would be a “colossal mistake.” He told The Washington Post in October, 2019: “If there was a vote before Thanksgiving, the agreement would be defeated.” (Note: As of December 9, 2019, major unions such as the AFL-CIO switched their support in favor of USMCA after changes were made to win the votes of House Democrats.)
